intro: Quinquina calisaya, commonly known as the Calisaya quinine plant, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by dark blue berries. It is known for containing quinine, a compound historically used in the treatment of malaria. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been the subject of botanical and pharmacological research.
